Parameter.Label: Minimum brightness level
Parameter.Help: The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

Parameter.Label: Maximum brightness level
Parameter.Help: The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

Parameter.Label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Parameter.Help: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.

Parameter.Label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Parameter.Help: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

Parameter.Label: Dimming Step at Automatic Control
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the percentage of a dimming step at automatic control. 1-99

Parameter.Label: Dimming Step Timing at Automatic Control
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the time of a dimming step at automatic control. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s)

Parameter.Label: Dimming Step at Manual Control
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the percentage of a dimming step at manual control. 1-99

Parameter.Label: Dimming Step Timing at Manual Control
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the time of a dimming step at manual control. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s)

Parameter.Label: Saving state before power failure

Item.Label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Parameter.Help: Saving state before power failure

Parameter.Label: Timer functionality (auto - off). 0 disables the function
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the setting of the timer. Available settings:1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h)

Parameter.Label: ALL ON/ALL OFF function

Item.Label: ALL ON not active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

Parameter.Help: The parameter specifies the available functions.

Parameter.Label: Force auto-calibration

Item.Label: force auto-calibration of the load using advanced parameter

Parameter.Help: Changing the value of this parameter to 1 will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 and switched to 0 upon completion.

Parameter.Label: Auto-calibration status (read-only parameter)

Item.Label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings

Parameter.Help: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

Parameter.Label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Parameter.Help: Binary inputs type configuration

Parameter.Label: Change [On-Off] bi-stable keys

Item.Label: Device changes status on key status change
Device status depends on key status; ON when the key is ON, OFF when the key is OFF

Parameter.Help: This function allow user to change [On-Off] bi-stable keys (parameter no. 14) (default value 0)

Parameter.Label: Double click option
Parameter.Help: Double-click set lighting at 100%

Parameter.Label: The function of 3-way switch
Parameter.Help: Key no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch).

Parameter.Label: Scene activation functionality
Parameter.Help: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configuration

Parameter.Label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

Item.Label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Parameter.Help: Switch S1 and S2 buttons

Parameter.Label: Load control mode

Item.Label: control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the used control mode.

Parameter.Label: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration
Parameter.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration

Parameter.Label: On/Off mode

Item.Label: on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

Parameter.Help: This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Enabling parameter 32 automatically ignores brightening/- dimming time settings.

Parameter.Label: Dimmability of the load (read only)
Parameter.Help: Dimmability of the load (read only)

Parameter.Label: Soft-Start functionality
Parameter.Help: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

Parameter.Label: Auto-calibration after power on

Item.Label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on

Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), SURGE alarm (Dimmer output overvoltage), OVERLOAD alarm (load power consumption too high)

Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), SURGE alarm (Dimmer output overvoltage), OVERLOAD alarm (load power consumption too high)

Parameter.Help: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

Parameter.Label: Behaviour of the Dimmer after overload or surge

Item.Label: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or push-button
three attempts to turn on the load

Parameter.Label: Power limit - OVERLOAD
Parameter.Help: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Parameter 39 is relevant only in a 3-wire connection i or a 2-wire connection for load of cosφ ≥ 0.99. (1 W - 250 W). 0 disables the function.

Parameter.Label: General Purpose Alarm
Parameter.Help: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

Parameter.Label: Water Flooding Alarm
Parameter.Help: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

Parameter.Label: Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
Parameter.Help: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

Parameter.Label: Temperature Alarm
Parameter.Help: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

Parameter.Label: Time of alarm state
Parameter.Help: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pushing the wall-switch keys or sending the Z-Wave command frame. Available settings: 1-32767 (1s - 32767s).

Parameter.Label: OVERLOAD alarm report
Parameter.Help: (load power consumption too high)

Parameter.Label: LOAD ERROR alarm report
Parameter.Help: (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

Parameter.Label: OVERCURRENT alarm report
Parameter.Help: (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

Parameter.Label: SURGE alarm report
Parameter.Help: (Dimmer output overvoltage)

Parameter.Label: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report
Active power reports
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 disables the function.

Parameter.Label: Periodic active power and energy reports
Parameter.Help: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report (1 sec - 32767 sec). 0 disables the function.

Parameter.Label: Energy reports
Parameter.Help: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh). 0 disables the function.

Parameter.Label: Self-measurement
Parameter.Help: The Dimmer may include active power and energy used by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

Group.Label: Sends BASIC SET command class frame according to the state of the device. The Dimmer in 2nd to 5th group allows for controlling 5 regular and 5 multichannel devices per an association group, out of which 1 field is reserved for the Z-Wave network main controller.

Sends BASIC SET command class frame according to the state of the device. The Dimmer in 2nd to 5th group allows for controlling 5 regular and 5 multichannel devices per an association group, out of which 1 field is reserved for the Z-Wave network main controller.

Sends BASIC SET command class frame according to the state of the device. The Dimmer in 2nd to 5th group allows for controlling 5 regular and 5 multichannel devices per an association group, out of which 1 field is reserved for the Z-Wave network main controller.

Sends BASIC SET command class frame according to the state of the device. The Dimmer in 2nd to 5th group allows for controlling 5 regular and 5 multichannel devices per an association group, out of which 1 field is reserved for the Z-Wave network main controller.
